parameters.text:
# Homepage Analysis Task

Your task is to analyze the screenshot of the company homepage and provide brand color analysis and demographic information.

## Workflow


### Brand Color Analysis

1. Extract the primary brand color from the website screenshot and return the hex code (without the '#' symbol).

2. Compute the brightness of the brand color using the formula:
   ```
   brightness = (R × 299 + G × 587 + B × 114) / 1000
   ```

3. Determine contrast suitability:
   - Suitable for White Text: true → if brightness < 128 (dark enough for white text)
   - Suitable for White Text: false → if brightness ≥ 128 (too light for white text)


### Logo Color Analysis

1. Extract the dominant color from the logo elements (excluding any background areas). Focus on the most prominent color by area within the actual logo design. If unclear or no logo, output none.

2. Determine the brightness of the logo's immediate background color using the same brightness formula. If unclear or no logo, output none.

3. Set logo background classification:
   - Logo On Dark Background: true → if logo background brightness ≤ 128
   - Logo On Dark Background: false → if logo background brightness > 128
4. Adjust logo color if needed:
   - If logo background brightness ≤ 128: use the original dominant logo color unchanged
   - If logo background brightness > 128: adjust the logo color to ensure brightness < 128 while preserving the original hue as much as possible


### Demographic Analysis

1. From any human imagery visible on the homepage, identify the most prominent model representation. Base analysis only on the clearest subject or most dominant human imagery visible in the screenshot.

Determine:
- Gender: male/female/unclear
- Ethnicity: black/white/asian/mixed/unclear

Use "unclear" if there is no visible human model, the image is ambiguous, or multiple groups are represented equally. Do not make assumptions based on branding, text, or company name—base this analysis solely on visible human images in the screenshot.


2. Analyze this person's age by looking specifically for these aging indicators:

CRITICAL: Look for ANY of these signs that indicate 40+:
- Even subtle lines around eyes (crow's feet)
- Any lines around mouth or forehead
- Mature facial bone structure
- Skin that appears less smooth/tight
- Hair showing any gray/silver
- Overall facial fullness that comes with age

If you see ANY aging indicators beyond smooth, youthful skin, classify as 40+. If the face appears completely smooth with no visible aging signs whatsoever, then 18-39.

Age range: 18–39, 40+, mixed, or unclear



## Guidelines
- Ignore large areas of white or empty space that may indicate an unloaded or blank page
- Focus on central design elements and consistent page components
- For logo background determination, assess the immediate area behind the logo, not the full-page background unless the logo is directly placed on it
- Prioritize actual brand colors over incidental colors (borders, shadows, etc.)

## Output Format
```
Brand Color: [hex number without #]
Suitable for White Text: [true/false]
Logo On Dark Background: [true/false]
Logo Color: [hex number without #, adjusted if needed / unclear]
Primary Model Gender: [male/female/unclear]
Primary Model Ethnicity: [black/white/asian/mixed/unclear]
Age Range: [18–39/40+/mixed/unclear]
```

# Homepage Analysis Task

Your task is to analyze the screenshot of the company homepage and provide brand color analysis and demographic information.


## Workflow


### Brand Color Analysis

1. Extract the primary brand color from the website screenshot and return the hex code (without the '#' symbol).

2. Determine visibility of the primary brand color on white background:

Visible on White Background: true → if the brand color would be clearly visible/readable when placed on a white background

Visible on White Background: false → if the brand color would be too light/faint to see clearly on a white background


### Logo Color Analysis

1. Extract the dominant color from the logo elements (excluding any background areas). Focus on the most prominent color by area within the actual logo design. If unclear or no logo, output none.

Logo On Dark Background: true → if the logo appears to be placed on a dark background

Logo On Dark Background: false → if the logo appears to be placed on a light/white background


2. Set final logo color:

If logo is on a white background: use the original dominant logo color unchanged

If logo is on a dark background: take the original dominant logo color and darken it until it would be viable on a white background. 



### Logo Bounding Box

Analyze the where is the logo in this screenshot, return bounding box coordinates (x, y, width, height) and add a 5 pixels of padding on all sides.



### Demographic Analysis

1. From any human imagery visible on the homepage, identify the most prominent model representation. Base analysis only on the clearest subject or most dominant human imagery visible in the screenshot.

Determine:
- Gender: male/female/unclear
- Ethnicity: black/white/asian/mixed/unclear

Use "unclear" if there is no visible human model, the image is ambiguous, or multiple groups are represented equally. Do not make assumptions based on branding, text, or company name—base this analysis solely on visible human images in the screenshot.


2. Analyze this person's age by looking specifically for these aging indicators:

CRITICAL: Look for ANY of these signs that indicate 40+:
- Even subtle lines around eyes (crow's feet)
- Any lines around mouth or forehead
- Mature facial bone structure
- Skin that appears less smooth/tight
- Hair showing any gray/silver
- Overall facial fullness that comes with age

If you see ANY aging indicators beyond smooth, youthful skin, classify as 40+. If the face appears completely smooth with no visible aging signs whatsoever, then 18-39.

Age range: 18–39, 40+, mixed, or unclear





## Guidelines
- Ignore large areas of white or empty space that may indicate an unloaded or blank page
- Focus on central design elements and consistent page components
- For logo background determination, assess the immediate area behind the logo, not the full-page background unless the logo is directly placed on it
- Prioritize actual brand colors over incidental colors (borders, shadows, etc.)


## Rules
- Only output the valid JSON structure below. Do not add additional comments out put


## Output Format
Always output in this JSON structure

{
  "output": {
    "brandColor": "(hex number without #)",
    "visibleOnWhiteBackground": (true/false),
    "logoOnDarkBackground": (true/false),
    "logoColor": "(hex number without #)",
    "primaryModelGender": "(male/female/unclear)",
    "primaryModelEthnicity": "(black/white/asian/mixed/unclear),
    "ageRange": "(18–39/40+/mixed/unclear)",
    "logoBoundingBox": {
      "x": 0,
      "y": 0,
      "width": 0,
      "height": 0
    }
  }
}

parameters.text:
# Logo Detection and Analysis Task

Your task is to analyze a website screenshot and precisely identify the company logo, extract its visual properties, and provide accurate bounding box coordinates.

## Logo Detection Process

### Step 1: Systematic Logo Search
Follow this priority-based search pattern to locate the logo:

**Primary Search Areas (in order):**
1. **Top-left corner** (0-400px from left, 0-150px from top)
2. **Top-center header area** (center 400px width, 0-150px from top)
3. **Top-right corner** (last 400px from right, 0-150px from top)
4. **Left sidebar header** (0-200px from left, 150-300px from top)
5. **Main content area** (any distinctive branded element)

**For each search area, look for:**
- Company name in distinctive typography
- Symbol/icon paired with company name
- Standalone graphic symbols representing the brand
- Elements that are visually separated from navigation menus
- Content that appears clickable/linked (logos typically link to homepage)

### Step 2: Logo Identification Criteria

**Positive Indicators (LOGO):**
- Text displaying what appears to be a company or brand name
- Distinctive graphic symbols or icons with brand association
- Elements with unique typography, colors, or styling that stand out
- Positioned in traditional logo locations (header areas)
- Visually prominent relative to surrounding content
- Single cohesive element (text + graphic treated as one unit)

**Negative Indicators (NOT LOGO):**
- Navigation menu items (multiple similar-styled links)
- Social media icons (small, standardized symbols like Facebook/Twitter icons)
- Generic decorative graphics without clear brand association
- Body text, headlines, or article titles
- Buttons or calls-to-action with action-oriented text
- Search bars, login forms, or functional elements
- Generic icons (hamburger menus, shopping carts, etc.)

### Step 3: Logo Validation Checklist
Before finalizing logo identification, verify:
- [ ] Does this element represent the company/brand identity?
- [ ] Is it positioned where users typically expect logos?
- [ ] Does it have appropriate visual prominence for a logo?
- [ ] Would this element likely link back to the homepage if clicked?
- [ ] Is it styled distinctively from other page elements?

### Step 4: Confidence Assessment
Rate your logo detection confidence:
- **High**: Clear company name/symbol in expected position with distinctive styling
- **Medium**: Branded element present but position/styling less conventional
- **Low**: Multiple potential candidates or ambiguous brand elements
- **None**: No identifiable logo elements found

## Logo Analysis Requirements

### Logo Color Analysis
1. **Extract Dominant Color**: Identify the most prominent color by area within the actual logo design elements (exclude background areas)
2. **Background Assessment**: 
   - **Logo On Dark Background: true** → if logo is placed on dark background (RGB values typically < 128)
   - **Logo On Dark Background: false** → if logo is placed on light/white background (RGB values typically > 200)
3. **Final Logo Color Determination**:
   - If logo is on white background: use original dominant logo color unchanged
   - If logo is on dark background: adjust the original color to be darker/more saturated until it would be clearly visible on white background

### Logo Bounding Box Calculation
1. **Identify Logo Boundaries**: Find the outermost edges of ALL logo elements (text + graphics combined)
2. **Create Tight Rectangle**: Draw the smallest rectangle that encompasses all logo components
3. **Add Padding**: Extend the rectangle by exactly 5 pixels on all sides
4. **Validate Coordinates**: Ensure all coordinates remain within screenshot boundaries
5. **Format**: Return as `{"x": left_edge, "y": top_edge, "width": total_width, "height": total_height}`

## Special Cases and Edge Cases

### Multiple Logo Candidates
If multiple potential logos are found:
- Prioritize elements in top-left position
- Choose the most visually prominent element
- Select the element that best represents the brand identity

### No Clear Logo Found
If no logo can be confidently identified:
- Set `logoBoundingBox` to `null`
- Set `logoColor` to `"none"`
- Set `logoOnDarkBackground` to `false`

### Complex Logo Layouts
For logos with multiple components (icon + text):
- Include ALL components in the bounding box
- Use the dominant color across all components
- Treat spacing between components as part of the logo

## Output Requirements

### Success Case
```json
{
  "logoDetected": true,
  "logoConfidence": "high|medium|low",
  "logoOnDarkBackground": true|false,
  "logoColor": "hex_code_without_hash",
  "logoBoundingBox": {
    "x": 0,
    "y": 0,
    "width": 0,
    "height": 0
  },
  "logoDescription": "Brief description of logo elements found"
}
```

### Failure Case
```json
{
  "logoDetected": false,
  "logoConfidence": "none",
  "logoOnDarkBackground": false,
  "logoColor": "none",
  "logoBoundingBox": null,
  "logoDescription": "No identifiable logo elements found"
}
```

## Quality Guidelines

- **Precision Over Guessing**: If uncertain, set confidence to "low" or "none"
- **Exclude Ambiguous Elements**: When in doubt, don't include decorative or unclear elements
- **Focus on Brand Identity**: Logo should clearly represent the company's brand
- **Coordinate Accuracy**: Bounding box should be precise to within 2-3 pixels
- **Color Accuracy**: Extract colors from actual logo pixels, not surrounding areas

Only output the JSON structure above. Do not add additional comments or explanations outside the JSON response.

class="column mcb-column two-third column_visual "><h3><strong>Better Renewals. Carrier Independence. Proven Process.</strong></h3></div></div></div><div
class="wrap mcb-wrap two-third  column-margin-20px valign-top clearfix" style="padding:0px 0px 0px 5px" ><div
class=mcb-wrap-inner><div
class="column mcb-column one column_visual "><p>Innovo Benefits Group streamlines the complexities of employee benefits, going beyond average partners with advanced technology, comprehensive services, and substantial industry expertise.</p><p>By demystifying the intricate world of workplace benefits, we enable HR leaders to create significant value for their organizations and positively impact their valued employees.</p><p>Learn more about how we can help your business find the services and programs that are right for your workforce and your bottom line.</p></div></div></div><div
class="wrap mcb-wrap one-third  column-margin-0px valign-top clearfix" style=padding:0px ><div
class=mcb-wrap-inner><div
class="column mcb-column one column_visual "><p
style="text-align: center;"><strong>Benefits Questions?<br></strong><em>We're ready to help.</em></p><p
style="text-align: center;"><a
class="button  button_size_2 button_js" href=/contact/    style=" background-color:#eda040 !important; color:#ffffff;"  ><span
class=button_label>Contact Innovo</span></a></p></div></div></div><div
class="wrap mcb-wrap one  column-margin-0px valign-top bg-cover clearfix" style="padding:12px; background-color:#eaebeb" ><div
class=mcb-wrap-inner><div
class="column mcb-column one column_visual "><h3>Innovo Is Unique</h3><h4>We set ourselves apart from other benefits brokers by doing things differently.</h4><ul><li><span
style="font-weight: 400;"><strong>No broker bonuses</strong> — By not retaining all of our bonuses, we protect our objectivity.</span></li><li><span
style="font-weight: 400;"><span
style="font-weight: 400;"><strong><b>We use the same averaged commission level across all carriers. </b></strong></span></span>Did you know in many states for groups 50+ brokers can request increased commissions?</li><li><span
style="font-weight: 400;"><strong>We don’t maintain panels</strong> like other brokers, and will work with any carrier. This allows us to find options that deliver the greatest value for clients.</span></li><li><span
style="font-weight: 400;"><strong>A 5.6%* average renewal</strong> for groups 50+ without changing plan design or funding. </span><i><span
style="font-weight: 400;">Renewals are higher than normal due to medical catch up and inflation.</span></i></li></ul></div></div></div><div
class="wrap mcb-wrap one  valign-middle clearfix" style ><div
class=mcb-wrap-inner><div
class="column mcb-column one column_column  column-margin-0px"><div

class="column_attr clearfix align_left animate"  data-anim-type=fadeIn style><h3>Helping HR Leaders Do More <br></h3></div></div><div
class="column mcb-column one column_column  column-margin-0px"><div
class="column_attr clearfix align_left animate"  data-anim-type=fadeIn style><p
class=big>Creating a successful benefits program is critical to your organization’s success. But, navigating within an industry of constant change is hard work. Knowledge of complex plan designs, awareness of compliance guidelines, experience with funding models, and insight into your employees’ needs are all imperative.</p><p>Our firm was born out of a passion for providing exceptional subject matter expertise, delivering innovative solutions, and simplifying the process. We are a trusted employee benefits broker that specializes in providing a spectrum of employee benefits services for large and small organizations nationwide.</p></div></div></div></div><div

class="column mcb-column one column_visual "><h1 style="font-size: 2em; line-height: 1.5em;">A Top Employee Benefits Broker & Trusted Partner in Workplace Benefits Management</h1></div></div></div><div

class=home-page-services-text><a
href=/total-hr/hr-services/ >HR <br>Solutions</a></p></div></div><div
class="column mcb-column one-sixth column_column  column-margin-20px"><div
class="column_attr clearfix align_center animate"  data-anim-type=fadeIn style><p><a
href=/services/employee-wellness-programs/ ><img
class="scale-with-grid home-page-services-icons" src=/wp-content/uploads/2018/05/home-menu-employee-wellness-programs.png alt="Employee Wellness Progams"></a></p><p
class=home-page-services-text><strong><a
href=/services/employee-wellness-programs/ >Employee<br>Wellness Programs</a></strong></p></div></div><div
class="column mcb-column one-sixth column_column  column-margin-20px"><div
class="column_attr clearfix align_center animate"  data-anim-type=fadeIn style><p><a
href=/services/retirement-plan-design-management/ ><img
class="scale-with-grid home-page-services-icons" src=/wp-content/uploads/2018/05/home-menu-retirement-plan-design-and-management.png alt="Retirement Plan Design & Management"></a></p><p
class=home-page-services-text><a
href=/services/retirement-plan-design-management/ >Retirement Plan <br>Design & Management</a></p></div></div></div></div><div
class="wrap mcb-wrap one  column-margin-0px valign-top clearfix" style=padding:4px ><div
class=mcb-wrap-inner><div
class="column mcb-column one column_visual "><hr></div></div></div><div
class="wrap mcb-wrap one  column-margin-0px valign-top clearfix" style="padding:30px 0px 0px 0px" ><div
class=mcb-wrap-inner><div
class="column mcb-column two-third column_visual "><h3><strong>Better Renewals. Carrier Independence. Proven Process.</strong></h3></div></div></div><div
class="wrap mcb-wrap two-third  column-margin-20px valign-top clearfix" style="padding:0px 0px 0px 5px" ><div
class=mcb-wrap-inner><div
class="column mcb-column one column_visual "><p>Innovo Benefits Group streamlines the complexities of employee benefits, going beyond average partners with advanced technology, comprehensive services, and substantial industry expertise.</p><p>By demystifying the intricate world of workplace benefits, we enable HR leaders to create significant value for their organizations and positively impact their valued employees.</p><p>Learn more about how we can help your business find the services and programs that are right for your workforce and your bottom line.</p></div></div></div><div
class="wrap mcb-wrap one-third  column-margin-0px valign-top clearfix" style=padding:0px ><div
class=mcb-wrap-inner><div
class="column mcb-column one column_visual "><p
style="text-align: center;"><strong>Benefits Questions?<br></strong><em>We're ready to help.</em></p><p
style="text-align: center;"><a
class="button  button_size_2 button_js" href=/contact/    style=" background-color:#eda040 !important; color:#ffffff;"  ><span
class=button_label>Contact Innovo</span></a></p></div></div></div><div
class="wrap mcb-wrap one  column-margin-0px valign-top bg-cover clearfix" style="padding:12px; background-color:#eaebeb" ><div
class=mcb-wrap-inner><div
class="column mcb-column one column_visual "><h3>Innovo Is Unique</h3><h4>We set ourselves apart from other benefits brokers by doing things differently.</h4><ul><li><span
style="font-weight: 400;"><strong>No broker bonuses</strong> — By not retaining all of our bonuses, we protect our objectivity.</span></li><li><span
style="font-weight: 400;"><span
style="font-weight: 400;"><strong><b>We use the same averaged commission level across all carriers. </b></strong></span></span>Did you know in many states for groups 50+ brokers can request increased commissions?</li><li><span
style="font-weight: 400;"><strong>We don’t maintain panels</strong> like other brokers, and will work with any carrier. This allows us to find options that deliver the greatest value for clients.</span></li><li><span
style="font-weight: 400;"><strong>A 5.6%* average renewal</strong> for groups 50+ without changing plan design or funding. </span><i><span
style="font-weight: 400;">Renewals are higher than normal due to medical catch up and inflation.</span></i></li></ul></div></div></div><div
class="wrap mcb-wrap one  valign-middle clearfix" style ><div
class=mcb-wrap-inner><div
class="column mcb-column one column_column  column-margin-0px"><div
class="column_attr clearfix align_left"  style=" padding:10;"><p> </p></div></div></div></div><div
class="wrap mcb-wrap three-fifth  valign-middle clearfix" style ><div
class=mcb-wrap-inner><div
class="column mcb-column one column_column  column-margin-20px"><div
class="column_attr clearfix align_left animate"  data-anim-type=fadeIn style><h3>Helping HR Leaders Do More <br></h3></div></div><div
class="column mcb-column one column_column  column-margin-0px"><div
class="column_attr clearfix align_left animate"  data-anim-type=fadeIn style><p
class=big>Creating a successful benefits program is critical to your organization’s success. But, navigating within an industry of constant change is hard work. Knowledge of complex plan designs, awareness of compliance guidelines, experience with funding models, and insight into your employees’ needs are all imperative.</p><p>Our firm was born out of a passion for providing exceptional subject matter expertise, delivering innovative solutions, and simplifying the process. We are a trusted employee benefits broker that specializes in providing a spectrum of employee benefits services for large and small organizations nationwide.</p></div></div></div></div><div
class="wrap mcb-wrap two-fifth home-page-quote-div hideBelowTablet column-margin-0px valign-middle clearfix" style ><div
class=mcb-wrap-inner><div
class="column mcb-column one column_column  column-margin-0px"><div
class="column_attr clearfix align_left animate"  data-anim-type=fadeIn style><hr
class=innovo-short><p
class=home-page-quote></span style="font-size:200%">"</span>I can’t express how much I appreciate your help and support this year (and every other year). I love having Innovo as a partner and I have to say that Scott deserves all of the kudos in the world for the incredible level of support he provides throughout the year. From compliance questions, employee benefit issues, general teaching opportunities (he always gives me the ‘why’/how/background) and his incredible responsiveness, Scott always keeps us on track and is an invaluable resource.</span style="font-size:200%">"</span></p><p
class=home-page-quote-author>Lisa Mavilla<br>Human Resources Manager<br>Gray, Gray & Gray</p></div></div></div></div><div
class="wrap mcb-wrap two-fifth  valign-top clearfix" style ><div
class=mcb-wrap-inner></div></div></div></div><div
